|Title=Know how trisomy 21 is diagnosed antenatally.
|Description=Know how trisomy 21 is diagnosed at birth
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=Elise Launay,Damien Sanlaville,Marie-Bérengère Troadec

In addition to biological screening, ultrasound monitoring helps to detect trisomy 21. If there is an abnormality on ultrasound, a foetal karyotype will be prescribed. The main signs are as follows:

In the 1st trimester: neck greater than 3.5 mm;

In the 2nd trimester: heart disease, hypoplasia or aplasia of the nasal bones, short femurs, indirect signs of duodenal stenosis... ;

In the 3rd trimester: intrauterine growth retardation with no placental cause, heart disease.

properties.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical ultrasound sign indicating trisomy 21 during pregnancy?
properties.option_a: Neck greater than 3.5 mm in the 1st trimester
properties.option_c: Indirect signs of duodenal stenosis in the 2nd trimester
properties.option_d: Normal femur length in the 2nd trimester
